content: In which Shakespearean play do the characters Rosencrantz and Guildenstern appear as friends of the protagonist?

Rosencrantz and Guildenstern appear in William Shakespeare's play "Hamlet." They are childhood friends of Prince Hamlet and are summoned by King Claudius and Queen Gertrude to discover the cause of Hamlet's erratic behavior. Throughout the play, their roles evolve, and they become entangled in the political intrigue and tragedy that unfolds.
